description: From Latin abductus, perfect passive participle of abduco (“to lead away”), from ab (“away”) + duco (“to lead”).

verbs.description: abduct (third-person singular simple present abducts, present participle abducting, simple past and past participle abducted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To take away by force; to carry away (a human being) wrongfully and usually with violence or deception; to kidnap. [Early 17th century.]
(transitive, anatomy) To draw away, as a limb or other part, from the median axis of the body. [Early 17th century.]
